column5: RBF, Tim Hortons is on Kings hiway on the left side of the road, I think its past the Husky gas station on the right side of the road.525 Hiway 11 West.

Are there any other restaurants or cafes for breakfast/lunch in Fort Frances downtown or going WEST on Hwy 11? We don't want to have to head East to others mentioned & then back track to go West. Also, we want to eat after we cross the border. Thanks again for any suggestions RBF
Make the trip to Green's in Nestor Falls. It will be worth the wait.Very Canadian experience.
Looking for a recommendations of good places to eat for Breakfast/Lunch in Fort Frances heading WEST on Hwy 11, or Nestor Falls or Sioux Narrows. Thanks for your help! RBF

Big John's just south of the bridge in Sioux Narrows has the best view of the lake. If you are towing something park parallel with Highway 71. Good sandwiches and breakfasts.White Birch Lodge in SN has a neat dining room with good food. Slightly more inconvenient to get to than Big John's.Monica's in Nestor Falls (west side of Highway 71) is also very good and has good parking. There's a Tim Horton's in Ft Frances.
We always have lunch at La Place Rendez-Vous in Fort Frances. It's a nice restaurant with good food and a view.http://rendezvoushotel.com/lakeside_dining
Green's BBQ in Nestor Fallls. Great ambience (Old fish and hunting camp feel). Very good Breakfast and lunch.. On the left side headin' nort'.
THANKS for all the suggestions! I will let our group pick which place they want to try.

We always ate at the Harbourage in Ft. Frances after crossing the border. It's a simple diner and they have a great breakfast. We ate at dinner at Green's about 15 years ago before flying out of Nestor Falls. I was grossly over-severed at the bar, so I don't remember much, but I seem to have had a great time.
The chocalate moose , on the right as your coming into International Falls is a good place to eat, they serve a very good breakfast, and big portions.

Chocolate Moose is a very good place to eat in IFalls. The other two mentioned that I've eaten at, The Harbourage and LaPlace-Rendez-vous are both very good also, but they are East on Hwy. 11 in Fort Frances so if you are west bound its out of your way.
We have been stopping at Tim Hortons for breakfast sandwiches, coffee to go and coffee for the cabin too!
Wally Dave where is Tim Hortons located in Fort Frances? We will be heading west on Highway 11. Thank you
